title: EFF Teams Up With AV Comparatives to Test Android Stalkerware Detection by Major Antivirus Apps
summary: The Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) collaborated with AV-Comparatives to assess the effectiveness of popular antivirus applications in detecting stalkerware on Android devices. Stalkerware refers to software used for tracking and spying on individuals without their consent, posing significant privacy threats. The study tested major antivirus apps to determine their capabilities in identifying these malicious programs. The initiative underscores the importance of reliable detection mechanisms to safeguard user privacy and highlights the ongoing challenges within cybersecurity to improve stalkerware detection and protection on mobile platforms.
